overview: This measure makes the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent. [1] It also establishes a three—year Women's Court Pilot Program in the circuit court of the Kona division of the Third Circuit, which is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [1] The Judiciary is required to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Firth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit. [1]
appropriations: Your Committee has amended this measure by inserting an appropriation amount of $514,900 (HB727) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] These funds are for services and two temporary positions for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [1] The measure deletes language that would have appropriated an unspecified amount of funds to the Department of Health for an unspecified number of temporary positions. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The fiscal projections are based on the success of the First District's Mohala Wahine program, which has been operational since January 2023. [1] [1] The need for the program in the Third Circuit is based on data and information provided by the Judiciary in testimony at the public hearing on this measure. [1] The provided document does not specify the cost estimation methods or data sources used to calculate the financial projections. [1]
agency_impact: The Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit will be under the supervision of the Big Island Drug Court. [1] [1] The appropriation provides for two temporary positions for the pilot program. [1] The Judiciary is required to submit a report to the Legislature no later than forty days prior to the Regular Session of 2026 regarding the need for and associated costs of expanding the pilot program. [1] [1]
economic_impact: Mohala Wahine aims to enhance community safety by reducing recidivism through evidence-based, trauma-informed care, and cultural practices. [1] The program addresses crime motivators such as substance abuse, mental health, and homelessness. [1] The existing Women's Court Pilot Program has been successful, with eleven participants in phase one of treatment and twelve participants in phase two of treatment. [1]
policy_impact: This measure amends prior law by inserting language making the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent. [1] It establishes a new three—year Women's Court Pilot Program in the circuit court of the Kona division of the Third Circuit, rather than the Second and Fifth Circuits as originally proposed. [1] The measure also deletes language that would have required the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a Women's Court Pilot Program in the Third Circuit. [1] [1]
